member.name: T:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentMap
member.summary: Provides mapping from PartCatalogueType to set of IComponentInstance objects which implement that type

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentState.Null
member.summary: The component has just been created, it has not been initialized yet. Cannot be returned from GetComponent in this state. If queried from the Primary thread, initializes the component; on other threads, fails.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentState.Initializing
member.summary: We're currently initializing the component. Can be queried on the Primary thread only if there're no nested component initializations (because such a condition means a circular dependency); on other threads, fails.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentState.Initialized
member.summary: The component has been initialized and its instance is accessible from any thread.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentState.Corrupted
member.summary: We attempted to init the component, but it has failed to complete its Init.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentState.Disposing
member.summary: The component is currently being disposed

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentState.Disposed
member.summary: The component was disposed and no longer accessible

member.name: P:JetBrains.ComponentModel.IComponentInstance.Instance
member.summary: The component instance. Three phases: (1) Non-Initialized component, is non-Null by construction, is False. Components are first all created, then all inited, that's why this state exists. Getting this component on the Primary thread inits it, on any other thread fails. (2) Running component, is still non-Null, is True. Possibly, not all components enter this state. Main state of the component when the product is alive. Such a component can be gotten-instance without any restrictions. (3) Disposed component. is Null, is undefined. The datas are removed from the dictionary in bulk, because the dictionary is copy-on-write, and until the pack of components is removed, those that were disposed are in this state. Getting such a component fails.

member.name: P:JetBrains.ComponentModel.IComponentInstance.State
member.summary: Init state of the component: whether it is ready for handing out or not, plus a couple service states.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.PartComponentInstance.myCatalogueType
member.summary: The decriptor from which the component were created.

(2) Running component, is still non-Null, is True. Possibly, not all components enter this state. Main state of the component when the product is alive. Such a component can be gotten-instance without any restrictions. (3) Disposed component. is Null, is undefined. The datas are removed from the dictionary in bulk, because the dictionary is copy-on-write, and until the pack of components is removed, those that were disposed are in this state. Getting such a component fails.

Components are first all created, then all inited, that's why this state exists. Getting this component on the Primary thread inits it, on any other thread fails. (2) Running component, is still non-Null, is True. Possibly, not all components enter this state. Main state of the component when the product is alive. member.name: T:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer
member.summary: Base class for component containers. Provides storage for components and initialization services

member.name: T:JetBrains.ComponentModel.IComponentContainer
member.summary: Interface for abstract component container

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myId
member.summary: Container ID for diagnostics

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myCatalogueSet
member.summary: Catalogue set used to retrieve parts from

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.mySelector
member.summary: Selects subset of parts to instantiate, e.g. handles parts overrides

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myPartsFilter
member.summary: Filter applied to select parts for this component container

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myChainedContainers
member.summary: Containers to chain to

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myDispatcher
member.summary: Marks the container's thread affinity.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myInterfaceTypesEverKnown
member.summary: The interface types of components that ever were present in this container, to tell apart the errors when requesting a nonexistent component that has gone away already or has never been here. Must be immutable, Primary thread copy-on-write, lock-free access on any threads.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myChangingPartsBinding
member.summary: When a group of component parts is loaded, and their instances are created, this flag is raised. Same for unloading. Prevents reentrancy in these methods because they use copy-on-write which is not reentrable. Primary thread modifications only.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myMapPartToComponent
member.summary: Looks up component instances by the type of their implementation. There're components without any interfaces, that's why we need this map at all. Must be immutable, Primary thread copy-on-write, lock-free access on any threads.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myInitializingInstances
member.summary: Holds stack of currently initializing components

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myMapTypeToComponent
member.summary: Looks up component instances by the type of their interface. This is the main component lookup bag. Must be immutable, Primary thread copy-on-write, lock-free access on any threads.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myState
member.summary: Current livetime state for this container

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myComponentsChange
member.summary: Signal to notify about components coming and going

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.myDependencies
member.summary: Records dependencies of components for disposal in reverse

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.Compose
member.summary: Initializes the components in the container.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.TryGetComponent(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the component whose interface type is . Returns Null if there is no such component.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.AddParts(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{JetBrains.Application.Parts.PartCatalogueType})
member.summary: The sink sees new items in the collection view.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.RemoveParts(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{JetBrains.Application.Parts.PartCatalogueType})
member.summary: The sink sees some items going away from the collection view.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.CreateInstanceIfNeeded(JetBrains.ComponentModel.IComponentInstance,JetBrains.Util.OnError)
member.summary: To be called from TryGetComponentâ€¦ only. Inits the component if it has not been inited yet. Usually the caller would check if the component is inited, for speed; we check here once again just in case. Primary thread only (ignored for already-initializeds).
member.param: Throw out to abort and never get an invalid component. Ignore or log to allow silent failures, check retval.
member.returns: True if the component is in the initialized state on return. False in case of problems, shouldn't be if throws.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.BindParts(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{JetBrains.Application.Parts.PartCatalogueType})
member.summary: Physical Creation. Component instances are created and added to the store, but not initialized.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.DisposeParts(System.Collections.Generic.List{JetBrains.Application.Parts.PartCatalogueType})
member.summary: Logical Destruction. Components are disposed of.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.UnbindParts(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{JetBrains.Application.Parts.PartCatalogueType})
member.summary: Physical Removal. Component instances are removed from the store.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainer.GetComponentsCore(System.Type,JetBrains.Util.OnError)
member.summary: Core impl for [Try]GetComponent. NotNull or CanBeNull depending on the params.
member.param: Throw out to abort and get NotNull, ignore or log to get CanBeNull.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainerEx.TryGetComponent``1(JetBrains.ComponentModel.IComponentContainer)
member.summary: Gets the component whose interface type is . Returns Null if there is no such component, or there are multiple components

member.name: M:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainerEx.TryGetComponentEx``1(JetBrains.ComponentModel.IComponentContainer)
member.summary: Workaround method which is used to obtain components ONLY in the scope of ActionManager which tries to workaround en exception when the application is being shutting down.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainerState.Initial
member.summary: The container has just been created and is not ready for creating the components yet. Call to proceed.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainerState.Initialized
member.summary: The container is running. The first pack of components has been created.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainerState.Disposing
member.summary: has been called on the container, and it's currently in the process of tearing down the components.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentContainerState.Disposed
member.summary: The container has destroyed all of the components and is functional no more.

member.name: T:JetBrains.ComponentModel.IComponent
member.summary: Base component interface.

summary.para: Initializes the component. Called by the component container after the component is created.
is the pairing method that's guaranteed to be called by the component container to tear down your component.
You must not access other components before your method is called.
All of the components that you access from are guaranteed to exist when your is called. Any other component might be missing by that time, and trying to get it will throw an exception.

member.name: P:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentChange.Instance
member.summary: The component instance.

member.name: P:JetBrains.ComponentModel.ComponentChange.CatalogueType
member.summary: The decriptor from which the component were created.
